desc: This recording captures the diverse sounds of wild animals in their natural habitats. Enjoy the symphony of nature as various creatures call, communicate, and interact with their surroundings.

sttData.content: Elephants are the largest land animals on Earth, known for their long trunks and large ears. They live in savannas, forests, and deserts.
Tigers are the largest cats in the world, with powerful jaws and sharp claws. They are found primarily in Asia and are known for their distinctive stripes.
Gorillas are the largest primates in the world and are characterized by their strong jaws and powerful arms. They can be found in the forests of central and eastern Africa.
Rhinoceroses are large, heavily-armored herbivores. There are two major types: black rhinos and white rhinos. Both species inhabit Africa and are considered critically endangered.
Lions are the only big cats that have manes. They are the apex predators in African savannas and are known for their powerful roars.

stt.sttSummary: In this recording, you'll hear about various wild animals, including elephants, tigers, gorillas, rhinoceroses, and lions.
